author: sky.cactus
content:
If we insist on continuing on this path though, at the least the goal should be to reach:
* Mission aligned participants rather than VC aligned participants.  People like Rotki trying to build permissionless, censorship resistant, self custody, apps/tools rather than people building centralized censoring tools.
* Small participants rather than big participants.  Solo stakers with 1 validator, not Coinbase, Kraken, and Lido.
* People in countries suffering significantly from financial censorship, not people in countries with functional financial systems.
* Users who actually use Ethereum for something other than a casino.  People who pay their bills with crypto, buy goods and services with crypto, use crypto to secure their assets, etc. rather than people who hang out on pump.fun, aave, yearn, and Uniswap all day long and cash everything out to fiat to buy their yachts.

author: sky.cactus
content: Of course, if we were to ossify this into something formal I'm sure someone clever would figure out a way to make Goodhart's Law apply.
